<small>Hebrew form: **<big>[[H7733|שׁוֹבֵק]]</big>**</small>
 [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שְׁבַק‎</span>] **verb** ==leave, let alone== ([[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שְׁבַק‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; compare Biblical Hebrew, p. 990); — 

**Pe\`al** ***Infinitive*** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְמִשְׁבַּק‎</span> [[Dan.4.23|Dan 4:23]] ***leave*** roots, so ***Imperative*** masculine plural <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שְׁבֻ֫קוּ‎</span> v.[[Dan.4.12|Dan 4:12]] v.[[Dan.4.20|Dan 4:20]] (both with <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ב‎</span> location); [[Ezra.6.7|Ezra 6:7]] ***let alone***, with <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ל‎</span> accusative of thing. **Hithpe\`el** ***Imperfect*** 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תִּשְׁתְּבִק‎</span> [[Dan.2.44|Dan 2:44]] ***be left*** (of kingdom, + <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ל‎</span> of a people).
